page.title: 12LIFEBOAT RESCUES, RHYL
page.content: Rhyl's most famous rescue was in September, 1962, when three men were rescued seven minutes before the pioneer Hovercraft which ran from Rhyl to Wallasey crashed into the sea wall. The R.N.L.I. presented the coxswain, Mr. Campini, with a silver medal and vellum to the rest of the crew. During the summer months a smaller inshore boat, carrying a crew of 2 or 3, is stationed at Rhyl for rescuing holidaymakers from dinghies, lilo beds and yachts. Their numbers have increased considerably in the last ten years. The annual number of call outs is 15 to 20 but for the past two years Rhyl has been the busiest station on the North Wales coast. In l984 there were 29 services and about 50 people were rescued and 30 of these were children.
